item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, December 30, 2024 at 9:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. From Pegasus to Predator – The evolution of commercial spyware on iOS [video] (178 points | 57 comments)
2. Pigment Mixing into Digital Painting (241 points | 41 comments)
3. KAG – Knowledge Graph RAG Framework (79 points | 19 comments)
4. The Cody Computer (138 points | 13 comments)
5. Nikon reveals a lens that captures wide and telephoto images simultaneously (50 points | 20 comments)
6. PolyDye: Full color printer mod for Marlin 3D printers (58 points | 8 comments)
7. Overloading the lambda abstraction in Haskell (2022) (20 points | discuss)
8. The Zombocom Problem (159 points | 39 comments)
9. Build a working game of Tetris in Conway's Game of Life (2014) (202 points | 20 comments)
10. Neuters: Lightweight front end to Reuters News (45 points | 17 comments)
11. Archibald Low's ‘ruthlessly imaginative’ 1925 predictions come true, mostly (35 points | 15 comments)
12. Rod Serling on Doomsday (36 points | 7 comments)
13. The last Inca bridge master (100 points | 17 comments)
14. Show HN: Chorus, a Mac app that lets you chat with a bunch of AIs at once (89 points | 32 comments)
15. Issues with object-oriented programming in Guile (11 points | 1 comment)
16. Trying to use Bluesky without getting burned again (191 points | 319 comments)
17. WebGL Fluid Simulation (407 points | 53 comments)
18. Is Iceland getting ready to join the EU? (246 points | 442 comments)
19. The history of twisted-pair Ethernet [video] (93 points | 13 comments)
20. Brave Care Has Closed (50 points | 86 comments)
21. Jimmy Carter has died (1040 points | 595 comments)
22. Against the Hydraulic Analogy (4 points | discuss)
23. Breaking NATO Radio Encryption [video] (116 points | 30 comments)
24. OpenAI’s board, paraphrased: ‘All we need is unimaginable sums of money’ (220 points | 200 comments)
25. Faster CI with Selective Testing (38 points | 36 comments)
26. Intel's $475M error: the silicon behind the Pentium division bug (360 points | 110 comments)
27. Melbourne Train Control System is running on a hardware emulated PDP11 (116 points | 30 comments)
28. Can LLMs accurately recall the Bible? (195 points | 128 comments)
29. Measuring and Understanding LLM Identity Confusion (14 points | 1 comment)
30. Show HN: WIP NandToTetris Emulator in pure C – logic gates to ALU to CPU to PC (28 points | 11 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, December 30, 2024 at 9:15 AM UTC
